intro: Melandrium hidaka-alpinum, commonly known as the Japanese sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Melandrium hidaka-alpinum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
